list.name: "Masanori"
list.desc: "Masanori" is a swordman who can be found in Tatarasuna.

list.name: "Gyoubu Koban"
list.desc: A bake-danuki from Chinju Forest.

list.name: "Kichiboushi"
list.desc: A little tanuki from Chinju Forest. Ioroi plans to pass the titles of "Bake-Danuki King" and "Protector of the Grove" to him.

list.name: Neko
list.desc: A talking Black Cat living at Asase Shrine. She claims to be the Provisional Head Priestess.

list.name: Ioroi
list.desc: A bake-danuki, who was sealed in a statue by Kamuna Harunosuke.

list.name: Eury
list.desc: A shopper in Mondstadt and Nimrod's wife.

list.name: Katheryne
list.desc: The receptionist for the Adventurers' Guild.

list.name: Moon Carver
list.desc: An Adeptus who lives on Qingyun Peak, Liyue.

list.name: Bolai
list.desc: Bolai is the owner of Wanyou Boutique in Liyue Harbor.

list.name: Ekaterina
list.desc: The receptionist at the Northland Bank. She will exchange leftover funds for Mora.

list.name: Halfdan
list.desc: An elite in the Royal Guard of Khaenri'ah under the Twilight Sword's command.

list.name: Anton
list.desc: Anton Melnikov is the Staff Sergeant of the Ninth Company.

list.name: Anthony
list.desc: Anthony is a man who wants to cure illness of his younger sister, Anna.

list.name: Anna
list.desc: Anna is a girl that has an illness. Anthony is her older brother.

list.name: Bao'er
list.desc: A Treasure Hoarder who claims to be an archaeologist. Under the guise of an archaeological investigation, she scours historical landmarks for forgotten treasure.

list.name: Ms. Bai
list.desc: A woman who oversees the mill at Qingce Village. She inherited it from her father. She will sell various food recipes and local specialties.

list.name: Ms. Yu
list.desc:
A public servant attached to the Ministry of Civil Affairs. She seems to be quite knowledgeable about the flow of goods in and out of the harbor as well as the latest rumors circulating on the streets.

Increasing your Reputation in Liyue might be just the key you need to gain her trust.

list.name: Blanche
list.desc: A shopkeeper who owns Mondstadt General Goods. She sells cooking ingredients that are often used in Mondstadt dishes.

list.name: Zhiqiong
list.desc: A member of the Adventurers' Guild. She has incredible talent for cartography.

list.name: Chen the Sharp
list.desc: A street-food vendor that was once a member of the Guhua Clan. He will sell various food items.

list.name: Eiko
list.desc: A member of the Adventurers' Guild. She was tasked with investigating Seirai Island.

list.name: Teucer
list.desc: Tartaglia's younger brother.

list.name: Timmie
list.desc: A child who is fond of pigeons. He can be found on the bridge leading to Mondstadt city.

list.name: Madarame Hyakubei
list.desc: Madarame is a member of the Yashiro Commission. Due to the nature of the Commission itself and the disposition of its Princess, he is quite well acquainted with the weals and woes of Inazuma's people. Madarame Hyakubei is also charged with helping the people solve various problems. If you help these people out and raise your reputation amongst them, you may obtain some precious items from Madarame...

list.name: Stanley
list.desc: Stanley is an adventurer from Mondstadt.

list.name: Tomoki
list.desc: A street food vendor in Inazuma. He is known for his Inazuma's creative cuisine.

list.name: Kiminami Anna
list.desc: The owner of Kiminami Restaurant. She sells various food dishes and recipes.

list.name: Lyudochka Snezhevna
list.desc: A former Fatuus who started a new life in Inazuma.

list.name: Saimon Katsumi
list.desc: Saimon Katsumi is an NPC located in Konda Village, Inazuma. Saimon Katsumi is the husband of Saimon Eri and the father of Saimon Jirou.

list.name: Saimon Eri
list.desc: Saimon Eri lives in Konda Village. Her husband is Saimon Katsumi.

list.name: Goth
list.desc: Goth is the owner and manager of Goth Grand Hotel.

list.name: Xavier
list.desc: He is a member of the Daydream Club, a group of inventors from Fontaine, the inventor of the Film Kamera, and the founder of a film company, "Musketeer Pictures."

list.name: Khedive
list.desc: A Sumerian Akademiya, Amurta member. In order to study the ecological changes occurring in The Chasm, he is providing funds to the Chasm Exploration Team.

list.name: Huai'an
list.desc: The innkeeper of Wangshu Inn. He manages the inn alongside his wife Verr Goldet.

list.name: Gendou Ringo
list.desc: A shrine maiden from the Grand Narukami Shrine.

list.name: Iris
list.desc: A member of the Adventurers' Guild. She is the older sister of Cyrus and Marjorie's aunt.

list.name: Wang Ping'an
list.desc: A fraud from Liyue who pretended to be a Yaksha and called himself Starsnatcher. After meeting Xiao, he repented and decided to atone for his sins by rebuilding Pervases's temple.

list.name: Marjorie
list.desc: A Mondstadter who owns the Souvenir Shop "With Wind Comes Glory". She enjoys collecting and sharing the stories behind treasures.

list.name: Margaret
list.desc: The owner of Cat's Tail. Despite her charming and witty humor in both promotional and casual talks, she admits that the tavern's recent increase in popularity is due to Diona's mixology.

list.name: Mountain Shaper
list.desc: An Adeptus living in Mt. Hulao, Liyue.

list.name: Jinwu
list.desc: A technician who has spent more than 20 years at The Chasm. She is the leader of the Chasm Exploration Team.

list.name: Wagner
list.desc: Mondstadt's blacksmith who despises small talks and prefers being left to his work.

list.name: Iron Tongue Tian
list.desc: A Liyue storyteller at Thrid-Round Knockout.

list.name: Cloud Retainer
list.desc: An Adeptus living on Mt. Aocang, Liyue.

list.name: Baixiao
list.desc: A secretary working for Ningguang in the Jade Chamber. She is the cousin of Zhenhai.

list.name: Baishi
list.desc: A secretary working for Ningguang in the Jade Chamber.

list.name: Baiwen
list.desc: A secretary working for Ningguang in the Jade Chamber.

list.name: Shitou
list.desc: The owner of Jade Mystery. He is often seen promoting the activity "Betting on Jade."

list.name: Liben
list.desc:
A merchant from Liyue who sports a striking appearance, as always. Well, as long as his conditions are as attractive as his appearance...

Once a small-time merchant who sold curios, he now collects common goods to sell across Teyvat.

list.name: Michelle
list.desc: Michelle is a windmill keeper of Mondstadt, whose family has worked with windmills for generations.

list.name: Master Zhang
list.desc: The owner of Hanfeng's Ironmongers. He is a blacksmith.

list.name: Allan
list.desc: A hunter of Springvale, who is learning from Draff.

list.name: Alfry
list.desc: A member of the Adventurers' Guild Intelligence Department. She works with investigators such as Fischl to provide information to adventurers.

list.name: Ella Musk
list.desc: Ella Musk is a scholar who researches Hilichurlian Linguistics.

list.name: Ellin
list.desc: A young lady who dreams of joining the Knights of Favonius. She can often be found honing her sword techniques behind the Knights of Favonius Headquarters.

list.name: Flora
list.desc: Flora is the owner of the flower shop Floral Whisper. She is the younger sister of Chloris, a botanist who can be found in Windrise.

list.name: Hanachirusato
list.desc: A mysterious shrine maiden from the Grand Narukami Shrine.

list.name: Sara
list.desc: The waitress of Good Hunter. She sells various food dishes, cooking ingredients, and recipes.

list.name: Ying'er
list.desc: The shop assistant for the Scent of Spring, a shop for fine vases. She is also knowledgeable about making perfumes.

list.name: Madame Ping
list.desc: Yaoyao and Xiangling's Master. She's an Adeptus, known as Streetward Rambler.

list.name: Aoi
list.desc: A shopkeeper who owns Tsukumomono Groceries. She sells cooking ingredients that are often used in Inazuma dishes.

list.name: Timaeus
list.desc: A Mondstadter who studies alchemy and seeks to educate others about alchemy's value.

list.name: Smiley Yanxiao
list.desc: The sous-chef at Wangshu Inn.

list.name: Hertha
list.desc:
Hertha, overseer of goods and supplies for the Knights of Favonius. If anyone understands the city of wind and the concerns of its people, it's her. Increase your Reputation in Mondstadt and gain the trust of its people, and she might even be willing to provide you some unique goods.

The captain of the Knights of Favonius' 6th Company who is in charge of logistics. Her work mostly consists of the charter and administration of baggage train, resource management and record-keeping.

list.name: Master Hui
list.desc: The young master of Xi the Maid. He often bets at The Jade Mystery hoping to strike rich.

list.name: Guoba
list.desc: Xiangling's friend, who inseparably accompanies her and helps with the cooking.

list.name: Sharp
list.desc: Sharp is a hired mercenary who calls himself as "Master Goth's Personal Security Detachment."

list.name: Hajime
list.desc: He is an apprentice swordsmith and Amenoma Tougo's senior disciple.

list.name: Aramis
list.desc: Aramis is one of the Knight of Favonius in Mondstadt. He can be found near the Favonius Cathedral.

list.name: Xu
list.desc: A servant of the Feiyun Commerce Guild. He works under Xingqiu, who he refers to as "Master."

list.name: Herbalist Gui
list.desc: A pharmacist who works under Baizhu. He creates and sells medicines at Bubu Pharmacy.

list.name: Archaic Lord of Lightning and Blitz
Kujirai Momiji
list.desc: The founder of the Kujirai Guild and the elder sister of Kid Kujirai. As the successor to the Kujirai Fishing Method, she believes that their hereditary art will help the Kujirai Guild flourish and gain fame across Inazuma.

list.name: Great Merchant Huang
list.desc: A traveling merchant who claims to be blessed by the Adepti.

list.name: Huangshan
list.desc: A guard for hire. She specializes in protecting cargo.

list.name: Wafiq
list.desc: Wafiq is a chef in Sumeru.

list.name: Jutta
list.desc: Jutta is a merchant from Mondstadt.

list.name: Ajilenakh Dash
list.desc: Ajilenakh Dash is a contestant of Beast Tamers Tournament.

list.name: Yanbei
list.desc: An event-exclusive NPC. He appeared during the Fabulous Fungus Frenzy event.

list.name: Souka
list.desc: Souka is a Light novel author from Inazuma.

list.name: Balfour
list.desc: Balfour is a staff of Beast Tamers Tournament.

list.name: Najah
list.desc: Najah is a student of Sumeru Akademiya.

list.name: Prince
list.desc: Prince is Margaret's cat and is also a Genius Invokation TCG Master at the Cat's Tail Tavern.

list.name: Swan
list.desc: A member of the Knights of Favonius. He can often be found standing guard at the entrance of Mondstadt city.

list.name: Patton
list.desc: A Mondstadter who works at Angel's Share. He can be found outside the tavern advertising the latest discounts and wines.

list.name: Lan
list.desc: Lan is the Liyue Adventuerers' Guild Branch Master.

list.name: Tea Master Liu Su
list.desc: A storyteller for Heyu Tea House. He was originally Iron Tongue Tian's senior but had later agreed to work under Fan Er'ye for a wealthier audience.

list.name: Qiuyue
list.desc: The Branch Manager for the Chuyu Trading Company. She is originally from Liyue and will sell various minerals.

list.name: Karpillia
list.desc: The owner of Sailing Breeze. She was originally from Mondstadt but was unable to compete with Angel's Share.

list.name: Rama
list.desc: A spice merchant in Port Ormos.

list.name: Taraneh
list.desc: A seemingly optimistic street performer. After having her heart broken by a cheating sailor from Liyue, she has decided to hire the best Eremite mercenary to hone her fighting skills and personally seek revenge.

list.name: Ahangar
list.desc: The blacksmith at Shamshir's Smithy. Iradj and Dwarkanath are his adopted children.

list.name: Azalai
list.desc: A grocery store owner in Aaru Village.

list.name: Jahangir
list.desc: A food shop owner in Port Ormos. He has a daughter named Ami.

list.name: Enteka
list.desc: The acting manager of Puspa Café. She can read people's fortunes from the coffee grounds.

list.name: Licai
list.desc: The waitress for Liuli Pavilion. She sells various Liuli Pavilion specialties and recipes.

list.name: Yueshu
list.desc: The waitress for Xinyue Kiosk. She sells various food dishes and recipes.

list.name: Su Er'niang
list.desc: A local street food vendor operating next to Wanmin Restaurant. She is known for her delicious Zhongyuan Chop Suey.

list.name: Verr Goldet
list.desc: The owner of Wangshu Inn. She claims to be from Mondstadt and moved to Liyue with her husband Huai'an to manage the inn.

list.name: Ashpazi
list.desc: A forest ranger in Gandharva Ville. He is a skilled cook and hunter.

list.name: Harris
list.desc: Harris is a chef, and he built the camp near Dragonspine to provide food for the adventurers.

list.name: Charles
list.desc: The bartender at Angel's Share. He will sell various drink-based food items.

list.name: Mr. Zhu
list.desc: The owner of Emerald Maple Inn. He sells various food dishes.

list.name: Pops Kai
list.desc: A tea vendor in Qingce Village.

list.name: Pops Zhou
list.desc: A tea vendor in Stone Gate. He is originally from Qingce Village but set up a tea booth to watch travelers come and go.

list.name: Brook
list.desc: Brook is a chef living in Springvale. She is known for her meat-based dishes and moved to Springvale to have access to the freshest meat.

list.name: Xingxi
list.desc: The owner of Mingxing Jewelry. She will exchange Geo Sigils for various rewards.

list.name: Hitotsume Kozou
list.desc: A little youkai who tried to revive the Mikawa Flower Festival.

list.name: Youko
list.desc: A little youkai who wanted to revive the Mikawa Flower Festival.

list.name: Kappa
list.desc: A little youkai who wanted to revive the Mikawa Flower Festival.

list.name: Hanyuuda Chizuru
list.desc: A yokai that emerged from an object and assumed a human form outside of her own body. She is a Tsukumogami.

list.name: Dvorak
list.desc: One of the main organizers of the Iridescence Tour.

list.name: Guizhong
list.desc: The God of Dust, also known as Haagentus. She died in the Archon War.

list.name: Menogias
list.desc: One of the five strongest Yakshas, also known as General Kapisas.

list.name: Bonanus
list.desc: One of the five strongest Yakshas, also known as General Chizapus.

list.name: Indarias
list.desc: One of the five strongest Yakshas, also known as General Musatas.

list.name: Bosacius
list.desc: Leader of The Yakshas, also known as Marshal Vritras.

list.name: Chang the Ninth
list.desc: The ninth-born child of the Chang family. He owns a mining business and is the author of "First Apprentice of Guhua."

list.name: Tubby
list.desc: Tubby is a Spirit that helps to build Traveler's own realm in the Serenitea Pot.

list.name: Babel
list.desc: Matriarch of the Tanit tribe.

list.name: Liloupar
list.desc: The Mother of the Jinn, under whose influence Gurabad rose and fell.

list.name: Azariq
list.desc: Quest-exclusive NPC. Member of the Tanit tribe.

list.name: Nora
list.desc: A little girl who usually plays around the Anemo God statue. She is the daughter of Patton.

list.name: Brother Qian
list.desc: A member of the Adventurers' Guild. He claims to be the best mahjong player in all of Liyue. He is also in love with Lan, the guild master of the Liyue branch.

list.name: Tiantian
list.desc: A recruiter from the Adventurers' Guild.

list.name: Herman
list.desc: A former famous adventurer. He is Ellin's father and wishes to help her in her training.

list.name: Huffman
list.desc: Huffman Schmidt is a hardworking and reliable Knights of Favonius. He is the older brother of Mika.

list.name: Yevgraf
list.desc: Yevgraf is a quest-exclusive NPC

list.name: Ilyusha
list.desc: Ilyusha is a quest-exclusive NPC

list.name: Orest
list.desc: Orest Snezhevich is a quest-exclusive NPC

list.name: Scarlett
list.desc: Scarlett is the successor of I. Ivanovna N., as known as codename "J" of the Hexenzirkel.

list.name: Fassben
list.desc: An event-exclusive NPC. He appeared during the Windblume's Breath event.

list.name: Plauen
list.desc: An event-exclusive NPC. He appeared during the Invitation of Windblume and Windblume's Breath events.

list.name: Lizzie
list.desc: An event-exclusive NPC. She appeared during the Invitation of Windblume and Windblume's Breath events.

list.name: Kaji
list.desc: A miner from Yashiori Island, he aids in repairing the Narukami Wards to suppress the Tatarigami. He is currently residing in the Kujou Encampment.

list.name: Takashi
list.desc: A man who lives inside a conch hut. He allows travelers to exchange three Mysterious Conches to open one of the three Common Chests in his house.

list.name: Blitzara
list.desc: Blitzara is a Whirling Electro Fungus tamed by Yae Miko. The name "Blitzara" was given by Souka.

list.name: Kindlejoy
list.desc: Kindlejoy is a Whirling Pyro Fungus that was tamed by Haniyyah. Its previous name was "Pyro-1."

list.name: Twirly-Whirly
list.desc: Twirly-Whirly is a Floating Anemo Fungus tamed by Layla.

list.name: Bongo-Head
list.desc: Bongo-Head is a Floating Hydro Fungus that was tamed by Traveler and Paimon. The name "Bongo-Head" was given by Paimon.

list.name: Linlang
list.desc: The owner of Xigu Antiquities. She will also buy any artifacts that travelers may come upon.

list.name: Nazafarin
list.desc: Nazafarin researches condiments to help her friend, Parvaneh.

list.name: Rana
list.desc: Rana is a quest-exclusive NPC. She is a Forest Ranger from the Vimara Village.

list.name: Schulz
list.desc: Wagner's apprentice in blacksmithing.

list.name: Chloris
list.desc: A botanist who claims to be the best in Mondstadt. She is Flora's older sister and sells materials and local specialties from Mondstadt.

list.name: Draff
list.desc: Draff Kätzlein is the head hunter for the village of Springvale. He is the father of Diona, a distant descendant of Olaf and part of the Kätzlein Bloodline. While he is a capable hunter and leader, he is also an alcoholic and a known member of the Four Drunkards. He will sell various meats during the day.

list.name: Kid Kujirai
list.desc: A group of identical brothers who will challenge travelers to a game of Temari. They have an older sister named Kujirai Momiji.

list.name: Dandy
list.desc: A member of the Adventurers' Guild. She will challenge fellow adventurers to a series of time trials across Liyue.

list.name: Daya
list.desc: An event-exclusive NPC. She appeared during the "A Parade of Providence" event and was in charge of the game "Project Connectivity."

list.name: Daneh
list.desc: An event-exclusive NPC. He appeared during the "A Parade of Providence" event and was in charge of the game "Antiquity Hunt."

list.name: Bahar
list.desc: An event-exclusive NPC. She appeared during the "A Parade of Providence" event and was in charge of the game "In Truth's Steps."

list.name: Farbal
list.desc: An event-exclusive NPC. He appeared during the "A Parade of Providence" event and was in charge of the game "Gathering of Stars."

list.name: Paz
list.desc: An event-exclusive NPC. He appeared during the "A Parade of Providence" event and was in charge of the game "Mimetic Replication."

list.name: Bahador
list.desc: An event-exclusive NPC. He appeared during the "A Parade of Providence" event and was in charge of the game "Concocted Reaction."

list.name: Jarjar
list.desc: A Pari born in the Vourukasha Oasis, Jarjar likes to set up challenge courses called the Lightcall Resonance.

list.name: Sefana
list.desc: A Pari born in the Vourukasha Oasis, Sefana takes care of the Sunyata Flowers.

list.name: Rashnu
list.desc: A Pari born in the Vourukasha Oasis, Rashnu is known as the Familiar of the Barsom.

list.name: Mihir
list.desc: A Pari born in the Vourukasha Oasis, Mihir is known as the Familiar of Thorns.

list.name: Sorush
list.desc: A Pari born in the Vourukasha Oasis, Sorush is a Bloomguard acknowledged by the Khvarena.

list.name: Fedhri
list.desc: A Pari born in the Vourukasha Oasis, Fedhri takes care of the Amrita Pool.

list.name: Zurvan
list.desc: A Pari born in the Vourukasha Oasis, Zurvan is known to be The First Pari.

list.name: Aramani
list.desc: An Aranara found in Mahavanaranapna. Aramani will sell local specialties from Sumeru.

list.name: Aravinay
list.desc: An Aranara found in Mahavanaranapna. Aravinay will exchange Forging Blueprints for stories.

list.name: Dongdong
list.desc: A resident of Qingce Village. After hearing about the many strange and wonderful voyages in his father's letters, he's decided to follow in his footsteps and join The Crux as well when he's old enough.

list.name: Félix Yogue
list.desc: An event-exclusive NPC. He is a member of the Daydream Club and appeared during the Evermotion Mechanical Painting and Duel! The Summoners' Summit! events.

list.name: Shuyun
list.desc: Works at The Cat's Tail. He helps translate what Prince and the other cats are saying.

list.name: Ararycan
list.desc: An Aranara responsible for the forest in Devantaka Mountain.

list.name: Garcia
list.desc: A quest-exclusive NPC. He is a member of the Daydream Club, a group of inventors from Fontaine.

list.name: Idyia
list.desc: An event-exclusive NPC. She is an Oceanid and the caretaker of the "Bottleland," Veluriyam Mirage.

list.name: Muning
list.desc: A specialist from the Ministry of Civil Affairs. He is in charge of the Chasm Exploration Team's material requirements.

list.name: Clitopho
list.desc: A former Treasure Hoarder. After being saved, he joined the Chasm Exploration Team.

list.name: Taliesin
list.desc: A bard from Mondstadt. He joined the Chasm Exploration Team in the hopes of recording new adventure stories.

list.name: Mamere
list.desc: A Melusine artist who lives in Merusea Village.

list.name: Xana
list.desc: A Melusine merchant from Merusea Village.

list.name: Estelle
list.desc: The owner of Beaumont Workshop. After working at the Fontaine Research Institute as a renowned scientist, she now uses her skills to develop advanced Fontainian machinery to aid her forging as a blacksmith.

list.name: Delaroche
list.desc: The director of the Fontaine Fishing Association. She was unanimously elected due to her experience as a former clerk at the Fontaine Research Institute and valuable contributions to the association by providing unused equipment from the Institute.

list.name: Eugenie
list.desc: An enthusiastic vendor who specializes in selling fresh produce. She's able to routinely sell imported goods alongside local specialties due to the advanced water routes in Fontaine.

list.name: Boucicaut
list.desc: The manager of Damoville Purveyor. After working as a traveling merchant and forming several connections abroad for many years, he has decided to return to Fontaine to continue business.

list.name: Sanguinetti
list.desc: The host of Hotel Debord. Underneath his calm and elegant exterior, he scoffs at customers who buy the most expensive dishes in an attempt to flaunt their wealth instead of focusing on and appreciating the taste of such fine delicacies.

list.name: Louis
list.desc: The manager of a snack shop in Court of Fontaine. He is known for his fish and chips.

list.name: Arouet
list.desc: The manager of Café Lutece. He is known to sell the most bitter coffees and the sweetest cakes.

list.name: Seymour
list.desc: Prototype 4ACV07 is a mechanical dog created by Alain Guillotin to protect his sister Mary-Ann Guillotin during her service in the Marechaussee Phantom.

list.name: Ann
list.desc: An Oceanid created by the consciousness of Mary-Ann.

list.name: Cosanzeana
list.desc: A Melusine gardener.

list.name: Verenata
list.desc: Carabosse's assistant.

list.name: Mary-Ann
list.desc: An Oceanid living in Annapausis. She is a hybrid consciousness Oceanid formed by the merging of Lyris and Mary-Ann Guillotin.

list.name: Hubel
list.desc: The "temporary" owner of a newsstand. He aspires to one day join The Steambird.

list.name: Hinterman
list.desc: A fishmonger living in Poisson. He offers a variety of ingredients and local specialties.

list.name: Mamoru
list.desc: A member of the Arataki Gang.

list.name: Genta
list.desc: A member of the Arataki Gang.

list.name: Akira
list.desc: A member of the Arataki Gang.

list.name: Virgil
list.desc: A former member of Spina di Rosula who wanted to find the treasure of the secret society, "Liliacruces Forum," and become rich.

list.name: Crossa
list.desc: A merchant and retired sailor. Unable to return to her former life as a sailor after an accidental injury, she now makes a living by helping old mates sell the wares they've salvaged underwater across their voyages.

list.name: Mequignon
list.desc: The owner of Bertin's House of Curiosities.

list.name: Topyas
list.desc: A Melusine musical performer.

list.name: Puca
list.desc: A Melusine who is interested in ores.

list.name: Carabosse
list.desc: A Melusine potioneer from Merusea Village.

list.name: Iara
list.desc: A Melusine fisher from Merusea Village.

list.name: Serene
list.desc: A Melusine located in Merusea Village, Fontaine.

list.name: Sluasi
list.desc: A Melusine located in Merusea Village, Fontaine.

list.name: Nantuck
list.desc: A senior fisherman in the Mondstadt Fishing Association and a soon-to-be famous sea-life author. He guarantees that his story about a heroic fisherman pursuing a giant black whale will be a literary success once published.

list.name: Jiawei
list.desc: An elite fisherman in the Liyue Fishing Association. After living a lifetime of adventure on the waves, he now pursues a more relaxed lifestyle by fishing and preparing meals for his wife.

list.name: Loumelat
list.desc: A fisherwoman in the Sumeru Fishing Association. She was born in the desert and found her Rashid after coming to Port Ormos and discovering her talent in fishing. After saving up enough, she plans to bring her parents here to live with her.

list.name: Salsa
list.desc: An artist and founder of the "Alliance of Artists to Overthrow the Evil Organization and Protect the Future of Fontaine."

list.name: Setaria
list.desc: A researcher from the Sumeru Akademiya.

list.name: Butrus
list.desc: A fishmonger in Port Ormos and an avid cat lover. Although he doesn't own any cats himself, he has unofficially adopted many in the surrounding area by continuously feeding them fish.

list.name: Pam
list.desc: A self-employed fishmonger in Sumeru City. She sells fresh caught seafood every day to support herself and her family.

list.name: Kiyoko
list.desc: A merchant from a wealthy family who came to Watatsumi Island. By selling high-quality goods at lower prices, she hopes to help contribute to the development of Bourou Village and the wellbeing of its villagers.

list.name: Obata
list.desc: A fisherman in Ritou. Although the Sakoku Degree has created several setbacks in terms of limited clientele and sailing range, he perseveres in continuing his family's legacy as fishermen in his hometown.

list.name: Zhang Shun
list.desc: A merchant and a former member of The Crux. After suffering an injury during the battle against Haishan and subsequently being saved by Beidou, he decided it was in the crew's best interest to retire. He now sells the various spoils he has collected during time as a sailor.

list.name: Uncle Gao
list.desc: A fishmonger in Liyue Harbor. Whilst he is adamant about selling his stock at a less affordable price than Uncle Sun's due to a seemingly ongoing feud, it is all part of a deliberate scheme concocted by the two in order to generate more profit for both of them.

list.name: Uncle Sun
list.desc: A fishmonger in Liyue Harbor. Whilst he sells his stock at a more affordable price than Uncle Gao's due to a seemingly ongoing feud, it is all part of a deliberate scheme concocted by the two in order to generate more profit for both of them.

list.name: Dongsheng
list.desc: The owner of Second Life. He used to be an avid adventurer but was later seriously injured in an accident in Dihua Marsh. After being saved by Xiao and narrowly escaping death, he has since retired as an adventurer and decided to open a shop under the name "Second Life" as a commemoration of that fateful event.

list.name: Changshun
list.desc: A businesswoman and researcher who specializes in Liyue Mercantilism. Despite rigorously researching and consolidating a successful business strategy, she laments that her shop has never had the honor of Rex Lapis' personal patronage. It is said that all shops that have welcomed Rex Lapis' presence and approval have all become famous household names.

list.name: Afshin
list.desc: A traveling merchant with a remarkable talent for storytelling. His intricately woven stories are able to convince anyone to buy his wares... providing that his two Sumpter Beasts don't get to the merchandise and eat it first.

list.name: Qiuwei
list.desc: An authorized retailer for the Feiyun Commerce Guild. The Liyue specialties she sells are highly popular with Sumeru residents.

list.name: Shiliu
list.desc: A merchant who sells artifacts from Mingxing Jewelry. She moved to Mondstadt in hopes of increasing sales but had miscalculated the fact that many Mondstadters would prefer to spend their Mora at the taverns instead.

list.name: Babak
list.desc: A researcher and the manager of the largest imported goods shop in Port Ormos. It is under the direct management of the Akademiya.

list.name: Alvard
list.desc: The owner of the "Rag and Bone Shop" in the Fortress of Meropide.

list.name: Bran
list.desc: A "Coupon Cafeteria" staff in the Fortress of Meropide.

list.name: Wolsey
list.desc: The Coupon Cafeteria Supervisor.

list.name: Marcel
list.desc: Leader of the Confrerie of Cabriere, a sister organization of Spina di Rosula.

list.name: Coralie
list.desc: A wife of the former Spina di Rosula's informant, Jacques.

list.name: Florent
list.desc: Spina di Rosula's senior advisor.

list.name: Thierry
list.desc: A Garde responsible for coordinating information between Spina di Rosula and Maison Gardiennage.

list.name: Melus
list.desc: Spina di Rosula's butler. He died during the evacuation of Poisson.

list.name: Silver
list.desc: Navia Caspar's attendant. He died during the evacuation of Poisson.

list.name: Effendi
list.desc: Researcher Effendi is a Liaison Officer from the Akademiya assigned to the Citadel of Regzar. He listens to various investigation reports, coordinates the work of the Corps of Thirty, and arranges for staff to help folks from Sumeru solve problems or expel monsters and bandits in the wilderness. Every once in a while, the Corps of Thirty will be otherwise occupied, leading Effendi to seek help from those who are kind and reliable enough to take the residents' commissions and bounty commissions. If you can help solve problems for the citizenry, this will raise your repute and allow you to receive rewards from the Akademiya through Effendi...

list.name: Euphrasie
list.desc: Euphrasie is the Chief Editor of The Steambird. She shoulders a great many responsibilities in addition to her work at the agency — she posts commissions for local residents' everyday troubles, assists the Palais Mermonia in putting up posters for criminals and dangerous monsters wanted by the Maison Gardiennage, and taps into the newspaper's powerful sources to find and contact people best suited for the missions... If you can solve problems for local citizens, maintain the order of the wilds of Fontaine, and build up your reputation steadily, you may earn rewards from different clients via Euphrasie...

list.name: Sonny
list.desc: The Spina di Rosula's "cleaner." He is also known as the "White Glove."

list.name: Luca
list.desc: Spina di Rosula's member.

list.name: "Shousei"
list.desc: A bake-danuki from Chinju Forest.

list.name: Ahes
list.desc: A Melusine who is interested in Captain Basil and ships.

list.name: Iaune
list.desc: A member of the Maison Gestion.

list.name: Henri
list.desc: A man who was tricked into destroying the Research Institute's devices by a Fatuus.

list.name: Caterpillar
list.desc: A member of the Narzissenkreuz Ordo given the title "Chrysalis of the Phantasmic Moth."

list.name: Lanoire
list.desc: Lanoire is the daughter of Agnes and the granddaughter of Earnshaw. She was born in the Fortress of Meropide and had never been to the surface.

list.name: Genevieve
list.desc: A former researcher of the Fontaine Research Institute of Kinetic Energy Engineering.

list.name: Roussimoff
list.desc: A Pankration Ring host in the Fortress of Meropide.

list.name: Clynes
list.desc: A former researcher from the Fontaine Research Institute of Kinetic Energy Engineering.

list.name: Blanche
list.desc: "Tricky Bulle Fruit's" sister.

list.name: "Tricky Bulle Fruit"
list.desc: A former member of the Fruity Order and Blache's adoptive brother.

list.name: Poiret
list.desc: A detective who is currently a prisoner in the Fortress of Meropide.

list.name: Chronie
list.desc: A journalist for the political affairs section of The Steambird.

list.name: Broglie
list.desc: An entry-level member of the Fontaine Research Institute who specializes in hydrology. He was previously responsible for monitoring Fontaine's hydrology data.

list.name: Sevigne
list.desc: A member of the Fontaine Research Institute. After working as one of Bossuet's assistants, she continued her research in the laboratory underneath Mary-Ann Memorial Park.

list.name: Coutrot
list.desc: The real owner of Kuisel's Clockwork Workshop, who had disguised himself as Coutrot's alleged research partner, Kuisel. He had previously worked at the Fontaine Research Institute under Raimondo and Bossuet but was kicked out of the organization due to his immoral research about converting humans into clockwork meka.

list.name: Balent
list.desc: A Fortress of Meropide employee. His job is to maintain the pipelines.

list.name: Aigouy
list.desc: A Fortress of Meropide employee. His job is to maintain the pipelines.

list.name: Callirhoe
list.desc: Callirhoe, also known as Spring Fairy, is an Oceanid who left Fontaine after the previous Archon's death and settled in Springvale.

list.name: Bricole
list.desc: A member of the Fontaine Research Institute. After witnessing Coutrot being kicked out of the Fontaine Research Institute by the Ethics Committee, he has been collecting clues about Coutrot's immoral research as part of an ongoing investigation of stolen assets from the organization.

list.name: Skirk
list.desc: A mysterious swordswoman from the Abyss and Tartaglia's master.

list.name: Scaramouche
list.desc: The former sixth of the Eleven Fatui Harbingers, created by Raiden Ei.

list.name: Jakob
list.desc: An orphan raised in the Narzissenkreuz Institute and later adopted by Karl Ingold. He became a Neohuman and the co-founder of the Narzissenkreuz Ordo.

list.name: Narzissenkreuz
list.desc: The leader of the Narzissenkreuz Ordo, formerly known as Rene de Petrichor.

list.name: Mary-Ann Guillotin
list.desc: The adopted daughter of Emanuel Guillotin and was raised in the Narzissenkreuz Institute with her brother Alain.

list.name: Alain Guillotin
list.desc: The adopted son of Emanuel Guillotin, who was raised at the Narzissenkreuz Institute with his adoptive sister, Mary-Ann. He is the founder of the Fontaine Research Institute of Kinetic Energy Engineering, with his most notable contribution to Fontaine being his research in Pneuma-Ousia, which led to the invention of the Arkhe system and the creation of Clockwork Meka.

list.name: Lyris
list.desc: The Director of the Narzissenkreuz Institute, an orphanage in Fontaine, she later became a member of the Narzissenkreuz Ordo and gained the title of "Red Empress" after the Institute was abandoned during the Cataclysm.

list.name: Basil Elton
list.desc: Basil was a retired admiral of the Fontaine Armada, Captain of the Sponsian, and Vice Director of the Narzissenkreuz Institute. She died 500 years ago during the Cataclysm.

list.name: Havria
list.desc: The God of Salt who was killed by her own followers during the Archon War.

list.name: Pahsiv
list.desc: A protector of the Erinnyes Forest. Although she looks like a Melusine, her kind is a mystery.

list.name: Pitot
list.desc: "The Rusty Rudder" Helmsman.

list.name: Urville
list.desc: An unsuccessful treasure hunter, who wants to earn money to cure his Melusine friend Nadia of amnesia.

list.name: Rouge
list.desc: A member of a group who punishes and robs other Treasure Hoarders to redistribute to those in need.

list.name: Penny
list.desc: Parker and Barrow's daughter.

list.name: Estienne
list.desc: Guard from the Fortress of Meropide.

list.name: Talochard
list.desc: An evidence clerk in the Marechaussee Phantom.

list.name: "Curve"
list.desc: A lie detector created by Dr. Mosso thirty years ago.

list.name: Rocher
list.desc: Melo Lombroso's husband and a suspect in the kidnapping of Sir Arthur.

list.name: Kevin
list.desc: A suspect in the kidnapping of Sir Arthur.

list.name: Baulande
list.desc: The Fatui peripheral personnel. He is also known under a codename Baulard.

list.name: "Intrepid Valberry"
list.desc: A former member of the Fruity Order and the Elegant Tableware Confrerie.

list.name: Remus
list.desc: The God King who built Remuria.

list.name: Egeria
list.desc: The previous Hydro Archon who died during the Cataclysm 500 years ago.

list.name: Focalors
list.desc: The last Hydro Archon and the God of Justice. She sacrificed herself in order to destroy the Hydro Archon's Divine Throne and restore power to the Hydro Dragon.

list.name: Skybracer
list.desc: A Liyue Adeptus who died during the Archon War.

list.name: Sea Gazer
list.desc: A Liyue Adeptus who loved collecting treasure. He was the previous owner of the "Fantastic Compass."

list.name: Azhdaha
list.desc: Elemental life form whose lifespan far exceeds that of mankind, brought by Rex Lapis to the surface. Morax carved him into a dragon and gave him eyes to see the sun. Azhdaha had been a friend and ally of the Geo Archon for many years.

list.name: Everallin
list.desc: A Melusine who is part of the Maison Gardiennage. Due to her extraordinary talent of sensing changes in the ocean's movements, she has been stationed in Romaritime Harbor to help observe the ocean and report of any oncoming storms or showers.

list.name: Hermosa
list.desc: A photographer who claims to be an adventurer instead. Many of her photos have either been published in newspapers or used as illustrations in books, with each one featuring her beloved cat.

list.name: Primordial One
list.desc: The First Descender, who defeated seven Dragon Sovereigns of the world and created people. The Primordial One may be Phanes.

list.name: Istaroth
list.desc: Ruler of Time, also known as Tokoyo Ookami, "the thousand winds of time," and Kairos, "the ruler of the unchanging world." She is one of the shades of the Primordial One.

list.name: Decarabian
list.desc: The God of Storms and the ruler of Old Mondstadt. He was overthrown as a result of an uprising raised by the people of Mondstadt, who could not withstand the tyranny.

list.name: Andrius
list.desc: The Great Wolf King of the North, a protector of Wolvendom and one of the Four Winds.

list.name: Vennessa
list.desc: A former slave, the founder and the first Grand Master of the Knights of Favonius, and the Dandelion Knight.

list.name: Dvalin
list.desc: An Elemental Dragon and the Anemo Archon Barbatos's friend. After being poisoned by the Shadow Dragon's blood, he became known as Stormterror.

list.name: Durin
list.desc: The Shadow Dragon and one of Rhinedottir's children.

list.name: Osial
list.desc: Overlord of the Vortex, who was defeated by Rex Lapis during the Archon War.

list.name: Beisht
list.desc: Osial's wife, who tried to avenge her husband.

list.name: Rhodeia
list.desc: The most renowned and strongest of Lochfolk scouts. She fled Fontaine after the death of the previous Hydro Archon and settled in Qingce Village.

list.name: Makoto
list.desc: Raiden Ei's twin sister and the previous Electro Archon, also known as Baal. She died during the Cataclysm 500 years ago.

list.name: Orobashi
list.desc: The Serpent God, who brought the people of Enkanomiya out of the Dark Sea and onto the surface. He was killed by Raiden Ei.

list.name: Rukkhadevata
list.desc: The Goddess of Wisdom, the previous Dendro Archon, and a friend of Nabu Malikata and King Deshret. She was completely erased from Irminsul to save it from forbidden knowledge.

list.name: Al-Ahmar
list.desc: The ruler of the Sumeru desert. He is also known as King Deshret.

list.name: Nabu Malikata
list.desc: The Goddess of Flowers, a friend of Greater Lord Rukkhadevata and King Deshret.

list.name: Apep
list.desc: Dendro Dragon.

list.name: Elynas
list.desc: An Abyssal beast that appeared in Fontaine 500 years ago during the Cataclysm. Elynas is the "Father" of all Melusines.

list.name: Carole
list.desc: Among the earliest Melusines introduced to Fontaine by Iudex Neuvillette roughly 400 years ago. She became the first Melusine to be welcomed into the Marechaussee Phantom and awarded the Medal of Peace. She sacrificed herself to prove Melusines' innocence in crimes.

list.name: Benoit Leroy
list.desc: Autumn's adoptive father, who gave his daughter in marriage to a rich man for the sake of money.

list.name: Athos
list.desc: Autumn's "husband" and a former owner of the Grocery. He killed the jeweler Brandt because he used underhanded methods to destroy Athos's stall.

list.name: Autumn
list.desc: Benoit Leroy's adopted daughter. She is also known as Morticia.

list.name: Molli
list.desc: Autumn's daughter, who was given up for adoption after her mother went to the Fortress of Meropide.

list.name: Fujin
list.desc: A carp Adeptus from Chenyu Vale.

list.name: Little Mao
list.desc: A child from Qiaoying Village and Lingyuan's friend.

list.name: Lingyuan
list.desc: An ancient Suanni from Chenyu Vale.

list.name: Herblord
list.desc: A snake Adeptus from Chenyu Vale.

list.name: Yuandai
list.desc: A white crane and Cloud Retainer's disciple.

list.name: Shuyu
list.desc: Cloud Retainer's disciple and Yuandai's granddaughter.

list.name: Grandpa Lu
list.desc: A Chunming Teaworks employee in Qiaoying Village.

list.name: Hautemontagne
list.desc: A researcher from the Fontaine Research Institute. She was sent to Qiaoying Village to repair the Three-Phase Asynchronous Elemental Tuner.

list.name: Uncle Luo
list.desc: Qiaoying Village Chief.

list.name: Jin
list.desc: A Chunming Teaworks employee and Uncle Luo's apprentice.

list.name: Bosu
list.desc: A ferryman from Chenyu Vale.

list.name: Ms. Qiu
list.desc: A filmmaker from Qiaoying Village.

list.name: Guijarro
list.desc: A Fontainian writer.

list.name: Huang the Third
list.desc: Guhua Clan's head doorkeeper.

list.name: Wen the Fourth
list.desc: A member of the Guhua Clan.

list.name: Woliu
list.desc: A hydrologist working for the Ministry of Civil Affairs. She is currently conducting a routine survey of Chenyu Vale's hydrological and pedological conditions.

list.name: Xiangjun
list.desc: A mysterious girl on an earthen raft.

list.name: Fangju
list.desc: Communications Office Staff from Yilong Wharf.

list.name: Iron Dou'er
list.desc: An undercover Millelith. She is investigating the Iron and Salt Gang.

list.name: Wenhua
list.desc: Owner of Yunyun and Chili Pepper.

list.name: Cassiodor
list.desc: Golden Hunter, one of Remus's Harmosts.

list.name: Boethius
list.desc: One of Remus's Harmosts.

list.name: Scylla
list.desc: The Prince of Vishaps and Remus's friend.

list.name: Dainsleif
list.desc: A former captain of the Khaenri'ahn Royal Guard, who was cursed by Celestia with immortality.

list.name: Caribert
list.desc: Chlothar Alberich's illegitimate son who became a hilichurl due to the Heavenly Principles' curse. He was used to create the Loom of Fate.

list.name: Chlothar
list.desc: A pure-blood Khaenri'ahn who was cursed with immortality by Celestia. He is a member of the Alberich Clan and the founder of the Abyss Order.

list.name: Florian
list.desc: A Marechaussee Hunter's successor and a writer of one of the Tabletop Troupe's scripts.

list.name: Wolfy
list.desc: A concierge of the Imaginarium Theater.

list.name: Rawat
list.desc: A researcher from the Fontaine Research Institute, who created Butterfly Dew cosmetics. His real name is Potton.

list.name: Alice
list.desc: The Sustainer of the World's Borders, Great Adventurer of the Realms, Dodo-King, Defender of Old Mondstadt, Friend of Adults Who Yet Harbor Hope, Author of the Teyvat Travel Guide, Originator of the Kujirai Art - Temari Jutsu, Supplier to the Renowned Lord Sangemah Bay, Elder and founder of the Hexenzirkel, Codename "A," Mother of Klee.

list.name: Rhinedottir
list.desc: An alchemist, a member of the Hexenzirkel, one of the five Sinners of Khaenri'ah, and Albedo's mother. Rhinedottir created an army of shadowy monsters, who attacked Teyvat 500 years ago. She's also known as Gold and R.

list.name: Nicole
list.desc: A prophetess and a member of the Hexenzirkel. She is also known as Nicole Reeyn and N. She is one of the last angels who remained conscious. She lost her voice and can only talk inside people's heads.

list.name: Barbeloth
list.desc: A visionary, a member of the Hexenzirkel, and Mona's teacher. She is also known as Astromancer Barbeloth Trismegistus and "B."

list.name: Andersdotter
list.desc: Anya M. Andersdotter was a mortal writer from Mondstadt and a member of the Hexenzirkel.

list.name: I. Ivanovna N.
list.desc: A member of the Hexenzirkel and the first Mayor of Snezhnaya.

list.name: Tsumi
list.desc: The last Vassal of Watatsumi.

list.name: Enjou
list.desc: A member of the Abyss Order, who calls himself a bookish character and a scholar. He's also known as The Thing Calling Itself "Enjou," Sanka, and The Thing Calling Itself "Sanka."

list.name: Chanca
list.desc: Owner of the Weary Inn and Zakan's Street Bites.

list.name: Bounama
list.desc: Merchant from the Bounama's Grocery.

list.name: Cipac
list.desc: Merchant from the Stadium of the Sacred Flame.

list.name: Cintli
list.desc: Merchant from the Collective of Plenty.

list.name: Alom
list.desc: Owner of the Salutary Furnace.

list.name: Echuah
list.desc: Merchant on the Stadium of the Sacred Flame.

list.name: Imix
list.desc: Artisan's apprentice from the Children of Echoes.

list.name: Siyah
list.desc: Manager of the Saurian Relics Association shop.

list.name: Little One
list.desc: A little Tepetlisaurus that received theBlessing. It accompanied the Traveler on a pilgrimage to the Great Volcano of Tollan to remove the mark.

list.name: Pacal
list.desc: Chief of the Children of Echoes.

list.name: Wayna
list.desc: Chief of the Scions of the Canopy.

list.name: Amina
list.desc: Chief of the People of the Springs.

list.name: Manqu
list.desc: A researcher for the Saurian Relics Association, who is responsible for scholarly inquiries into certain tribal customs. The real Manqu was a craftsman who lived a thousand years ago and died during the overthrow of the tyrant Och-Kan. Now, Manqu is a phlogiston projection of Waxaklahun Ubah Kan.

list.name: Titu
list.desc: Storyteller of the Children of Echoes and a guard at the sentry post. The real Titu lived about 500 years ago, and then his image was used by Waxaklahun Ubah Kan.

list.name: Arana
list.desc: An Aranara caring for her human friend, Rana.

list.name: Arama
list.desc: An Aranara, who became a new Ashvattha Tree.

list.name: Aramuhukunda
list.desc: The first Aranara.

list.name: Araja
list.desc: An Aranara, who placed Vanarana in dreams to protect it.

list.name: Ronova
list.desc: The Ruler of Death, one of the Primordial One's Shades.

list.name: Yohualtecuhtin, Lord of the Night
list.desc: An angel who created the Night Kingdom in Natlan.

list.name: Xbalanque
list.desc: The first Pyro Archon, who defeated the Flamelord and revived from the flames.

list.name: Asmoday
list.desc: A sustainer of Heavenly Principles, who separated the Traveler and their twin, and one of the four shades.

list.name: Amazolli
list.desc: The owner of the "Idukan's Trove."

list.name: Mutota
list.desc: Chief of the Flower-Feather Clan.

list.name: Biram
list.desc: Chief of the Masters of the Night-Wind.

list.name: Oroluk
list.desc: One of the staff at the Natlan Fishing Association.

list.name: Allpa
list.desc: Elder of the Flower-Feather Clan.

list.name: Bona
list.desc: An adventurer who went to Ochkanatlan to find the Jade of Return that can cleanse filth. She lived almost 500 years ago.

list.name: Och-Kan
list.desc: A dragon mixed with a human soul, the ruler of the Cinder City, known as the Python King and Sacred Lord.

list.name: Waxaklahun Ubah Kan
list.desc: The wisest among dragons, who stole the flame from his kind and taught people how to use it. He wanted to create a ruler of the dragon and human worlds. His true name is Kukulkan.

list.name: Xiuhcoatl
list.desc: The Pyro Sovereign, defeated by the first Pyro Archon, Xbalanque. He faked his own death, after which the descendants of the ancient dragons could only bow before the throne and watch as their civilization inevitably faded away with each passing day.

list.name: Chitose
list.desc: A code name of a Shuumatsuban agent, also known as Momoyo.

list.name: Il Capitano
list.desc: The First of the Eleven Fatui Harbingers and the Sentinel Knight of Khaenri'ah. His real name is Thrain.

list.name: Anchieta
list.desc: The boss of Djembe Studios from the People of the Springs.

list.name: Gosoythoth
list.desc: A monster of the void, named Gosoythoth, "Reaper of the Abyss."

list.name: Paimon
list.desc: The Traveler's best friend and Teyvat guide.

list.name: Barbatos
list.desc: The Anemo Archon of Mondstadt.

list.name: Morax
list.desc: The Geo Archon of Liyue.

list.name: Beelzebul
list.desc: The Electro Archon of Inazuma, known as Raiden Ei.

list.name: Buer
list.desc: The Dendro Archon of Sumeru.

list.name: Haborym
list.desc: The name Haborym is supposedly borne by all mortal Archons of Natlan. The current Archon is Mavuika.

list.name: Tsaritsa
list.desc: The Cryo Archon of Snezhnaya.

list.name: Pierro
list.desc: The first Fatuus, also known as The Jester. He was a royal mage in Khaenri'ah and was cursed with immortality.

list.name: Il Dottore
list.desc: The Second of the Eleven Fatui Harbingers, codenamed The Doctor. Had multiple "segments" of himself, nearly all of which he destroyed in a deal with the Dendro Archon.

list.name: Columbina
list.desc: The Third of the Eleven Fatui Harbingers, known as Damselette and Moon Maiden.

list.name: Arlecchino
list.desc: The Fourth of the Eleven Fatui Harbingers, known as The Knave. Her real name is Peruere.

list.name: Pulcinella
list.desc: The Fifth of the Eleven Fatui Harbingers, known as The Rooster. He is a mayor of Snezhnaya.

list.name: Sandrone
list.desc: The Seventh of the Eleven Fatui Harbingers, known as Marionette.

list.name: La Signora
list.desc: The Eighth of the Eleven Fatui Harbingers, also known as The Fair Lady. Her real name is Rosalyne-Kruzchka Lohefalter.

list.name: Pantalone
list.desc: The Ninth of the Eleven Fatui Harbingers, known as Regrator. He is in charge of Snezhnaya's economic policies.

list.name: Tartaglia
list.desc: The Eleventh of the Eleven Fatui Harbingers, known as Childe. His real name is Ajax.

list.name: Hroptatyr
list.desc: One of the Five Sinners of Khaenri'ah, also known as "The Wise."

list.name: Vedrfolnir
list.desc: One of the Five Sinners of Khaenri'ah, also known as "The Visionary."

list.name: Surtalogi
list.desc: One of the Five Sinners of Khaenri'ah, also known as "The Foul."

list.name: Rerir
list.desc: One of the Five Sinners of Khaenri'ah, also known as "Rächer of Solnari."

list.name: Nibelung
list.desc: The leader of the elemental dragons, who traveled beyond the world of Teyvat to gain the power of the Abyss to fight the Heavenly Principles.

list.name: Tenoch
list.desc: A hero of Natlan, who lived 500 years ago. He didn't belong to any tribe, because he was exiled. During the Cataclysm, he united the six tribes and went to the western islands to fight a giant black monster.

list.name: Tupac
list.desc: A giant from the People of the Springs and one of the six heroes of Natlan with the Ancient Name He died during the Cataclysm 500 years ago.

list.name: Sundjatta
list.desc: Chief of the Children of Echoes and one of the six heroes of Natlan with the Ancient NameHe died during the Cataclysm 500 years ago.

list.name: Wanjiru
list.desc: One of the six heroes of Natlan who bore the Ancient NameShe died during the Cataclysm 500 years ago.

list.name: Menilek
list.desc: One of the six heroes of Natlan and the bearer of the Ancient NameHe died during the Cataclysm 500 years ago.

list.name: Sanhaj
list.desc: The great priest of the Masters of the Night-Wind and Border Master, who bore the Ancient NameHe died in the Battle of the Mare Jivari 500 years ago.

list.name: Burkina
list.desc: One of the six heroes of Natlan who bore the Ancient NameHe died during the Cataclysm 500 years ago at the hands of his companion.

list.name: Takuya
list.desc: A blue oni who is currently in custody after attacking people in a group of Nobushi.

list.name: Kitsune Saiguu
list.desc: A Kitsune from the Hakushin clan, who was worshiped as a kitsune goddess. She died 500 years ago during the Cataclysm.

list.name: Sasayuri
list.desc: A tengu and the general of the Inazuman army. He died in the war with Orobashi 2,000 years ago.

list.name: Mikoshi Chiyo
list.desc: Raiden Ei's loyal lieutenant, driven mad by the Nightmare after the Cataclysm. She was defeated by Ei.

list.name: Kamuna Harunosuke
list.desc: The creator of the Mystic Onmyou Chamber, who lived about 500 years ago.

list.name: Acatl
list.desc: Chief of the Collective of Plenty.

list.name: Mini Durin
